H0.text: Construction of 3‑D models has most likely led scientists to better identify and discover new species of plants, a result of their long‑standing practice of classifying plants according to their characteristics.

H1.text: Advances in the study of DNA have led scientists to better identify and discover new species of plants, building on years of classifying plants according to their characteristics.

H2.text: Understanding the process of mitosis has led scientists, who have classified plants according to their characteristics for years, to better identify and discover new species of plants.

H3.text: The development of the scientific method most likely has led scientists to better identify and discover new species of plants, as scientists have classified plants according to their characteristics for years.

A4.text: DNA barcoding, wherein the species of an individual organism is identified using small sections of mitochondrial DNA or chloroplast DNA.

A5.text: Molecular phylogeny uses such data to build a 'relationship tree' that shows the probable evolution of various organisms.
